title: 820-3024-B with dim green light
message:
Hello everyone i got a macbook air a1370 820-3024 that came in with a dim green light and no power. During visual inspection i found that it was missing TPS51980. I replaced this chip and i still not getting the fan to spin. Could the isl be causing this issue? I checked my voltages and I'm getting the following

PPBUS_G3H 0.10v
PPDCIN_G3H 16.98v
PP3V42_G3H 0.25

Thanks,

title: 820-3024-B with dim green light
message: Uhm 3V42 is the first thing you need. The TPS51980 missing could prove very fatal as there is nothing stopping the high side FETs from letting 12V from PPBUS onto 3V and 5V rails. I think this board will be a time waster.

title: 820-3024-B with dim green light
message: will i be able to get pp3v42 without the tps51980? im thinking of removing that chip and focusing on the pp3v42 and then take it from there. Thanks!!!

title: 820-3024-B with dim green light
message: Why would you remove that chip when you know it's going to send 12v down your 3.3 v and 5v rails?

title: 820-3024-B with dim green light
message: No, you cannot remove a controller chip, it can destroy the board. I'm pretty sure this board is already fried to hell.

title: 820-3024-B with dim green light
message: I have returned the macbook to the customer. Thanks for your input dukes!
